guide.introduction: The cake is 65" and 4.5" high. This makes the scale of one "block" (Mario, a block, a Goomba, a flower, etc.) only 1/3" high. Hope your eyesight is good and your hands steady!
guide.introduction_rendered:
The cake is 65" and 4.5" high. This makes the scale of one "block" (Mario, a block, a Goomba, a flower, etc.) only 1/3" high. Hope your eyesight is good and your hands steady!

Relevant parts
  • two half sheet cakes
  • fondant
  • cake dyes (gel)
Tools
  • Sharp knife
  • food color markers
  • sheet cake pans

lines.text: You can make the cake to any scale you want, but if you use the same one I did, you'll get a 65" long cake that's 4.5" high with a 1/3" block scale. By "block," I mean the measuring unit of everything Mario. A block of bricks is one block, which is also the size (or multiplier thereof) of most other things. That means each little item you carve out of fondant will have to fit within a 1/3" square.
lines.text_raw: You can make the cake to any scale you want, but if you use the same one I did, you'll get a 65" long cake that's 4.5" high with a 1/3" block scale. By "block," I mean the measuring unit of everything Mario. A block of bricks is one block, which is also the size (or multiplier thereof) of most other things. That means each little item you carve out of fondant will have to fit within a 1/3" square.

lines.text: Use the image linked in the guide to place pieces on the cake. All the images here were first attacked by hungry players.
lines.text_raw: Use the image linked in the guide to place pieces on the cake. All the images here were first attacked by hungry players.

lines.text: If you cut two half sheet cakes into thirds, you'll have six 4.3-4.5" wide pieces, depending on your cutting precision and the evenness of your baking. Place five of these lengths end to end to make the actual cake.
lines.text_raw: If you cut two half sheet cakes into thirds, you'll have six 4.3-4.5" wide pieces, depending on your cutting precision and the evenness of your baking. Place five of these lengths end to end to make the actual cake.

lines.text: Frost it lightly and smoothly with buttercream. It's not worth trying to get it in the fridge first.
lines.text_raw: Frost it lightly and smoothly with buttercream. It's not worth trying to get it in the fridge first.

lines.text: Cover the entire length of the cake in sky blue fondant. If you're really good, you can roll the entire length at once. More likely, you'll have to smooth some seams. Use Crisco to help them blend together.
lines.text_raw: Cover the entire length of the cake in sky blue fondant. If you're really good, you can roll the entire length at once. More likely, you'll have to smooth some seams. Use Crisco to help them blend together.

lines.text: Next it's time to start cutting tiny pieces! I recommend printing out an image of the scene at the scale you've chosen to help. Here's just such an image: http://www.explodingrabbit.com/forum/att...
lines.text_raw: Next it's time to start cutting tiny pieces! I recommend printing out an image of the scene at the scale you've chosen to help. Here's just such an image:  http://www.explodingrabbit.com/forum/attachments/mario-1-1-gif.588/

lines.text: Here are all the tiny pieces you'll need to dye fondant for, then roll out and cut. Make markings on clouds and bricks with food markers. (The pieces in this picture have been attacked by hungry children and aren't what we'd call properly aligned.)
lines.text_raw: Here are all the tiny pieces you'll need to dye fondant for, then roll out and cut. Make markings on clouds and bricks with food markers. (The pieces in this picture have been attacked by hungry children and aren't what we'd call properly aligned.)

lines.text: Clouds come in one-hump, two-hump, and three-hump. You'll need 9, 4, and 4, respectively.
lines.text_raw: Clouds come in one-hump, two-hump, and three-hump. You'll need 9, 4, and 4, respectively.

lines.text: Bushes similarly come in  one-hump, two-hump, and three-hump varieties. You'll need 4, 4, and 3, respectively as well as two "half-humps."
lines.text_raw: Bushes similarly come in  one-hump, two-hump, and three-hump varieties. You'll need 4, 4, and 3, respectively as well as two "half-humps."

lines.text: Hills come in size "1" and size "3," which I named based on the marks on them. You'll need 5 size 1 and 5 size 3.
lines.text_raw: Hills come in size "1" and size "3," which I named based on the marks on them. You'll need 5 size 1 and 5 size 3.

lines.text: You can either do the brick sections all as single blocks, or you can do the multi-block brick lengths as chunks. If you do, you'll need 10 1-block segments, 3 2-block, 2 3-block, and one 8-block. You'll also need 13 question mark blocks. Draw the question marks on with red markers. For the ground that runs along the bottom, you'll need 65" minus a few spots where Mario can fall through the hole.
lines.text_raw: You can either do the brick sections all as single blocks, or you can do the multi-block brick lengths as chunks. If you do, you'll need 10 1-block segments, 3 2-block, 2 3-block, and one 8-block. You'll also need 13 question mark blocks. Draw the question marks on with red markers. For the ground that runs along the bottom, you'll need 65" minus a few spots where Mario can fall through the hole.

lines.text: The different type of blocks that Mario jump up like stairs can either be cut all as one or individually as squares. If individually, you'll need 89.
lines.text_raw: The different type of blocks that Mario jump up like stairs can either be cut all as one or individually as squares. If individually, you'll need 89.

lines.text: Pipes are not as consistently measured in height as other things, so that's why I recommended printing at your chosen scale to measure.
lines.text_raw: Pipes are not as consistently measured in height as other things, so that's why I recommended printing at your chosen scale to measure.

lines.text: You'll also need an assortment of Goombas, coin(s), a star, a one up mushroom, fire flower, size mushroom, and a turtle. Don't forget the castle and the flag!
lines.text_raw: You'll also need an assortment of Goombas, coin(s), a star, a one up mushroom, fire flower, size mushroom, and a turtle. Don't forget the castle and the flag!

lines.text: Last, but not least, you'll need Mario. Don't forget to make tiny Mario, big Mario, and fire Mario for full playable fun!
lines.text_raw: Last, but not least, you'll need Mario. Don't forget to make tiny Mario, big Mario, and fire Mario for full playable fun!

lines.text: Now that you've got all the parts, you can play with your food. Feel free to draw fireworks over the castle when you get to the end.
lines.text_raw: Now that you've got all the parts, you can play with your food. Feel free to draw fireworks over the castle when you get to the end.

lines.text: Humming the theme while playing is mandatory.
lines.text_raw: Humming the theme while playing is mandatory.

guide.summary: Have your game and eat it too! Play through the whole first level of the original Super Mario Brothers in a 65" long cake. Perfect for your next 80s-themed (Halloween) party.
guide.title: Playable Super Mario Cake
